statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Anthony Gurley scored 28 points and Massachusetts shot 52.7 percent en route to a 78-69 win over St. Bonaventure on Wednesday night.
article.headline: Anthony Gurley, UMass on the mark in beating Bonnies
article.linkText: Gurley, UMass on the mark in beating Bonnies
article.story: OLEAN, N.Y. -- Anthony Gurley scored 28 points and Massachusetts shot 52.7 percent en route to a 78-69 win over St. Bonaventure on Wednesday night. The Minutemen (12-7, 4-2 Atlantic 10 Conference) led 45-43 with 14:36 left to play and extended their lead to 57-45 with 11:31 to go. UMass led by at least seven the rest of the way. UMass went 29 for 55 from the field and outscored the Bonnies 46-22 in the paint. Javorn Farrell scored 16 points for the Minutemen, who fell behind after a 3-pointer from Demitrius Conger in the game's first 15 seconds but never trailed again. UMass posted a 22-2 edge in points inside during the first half and entered the break with a 39-31 lead. Marquise Simmons led St. Bonaventure (10-9, 2-4) with a career-high 14 points. Michael Davenport added 12 and Andrew Nicholson 11. The Bonnies went 21 of 59 from the floor (35.6 percent).
